questions.explanation:
7. When does your bus leave?
(A) The station is on Liberty Avenue. → Incorrect (refers to location, not time)
(B) A seat in the back. → Incorrect (refers to seating, not departure time)
(C) At eight o'clock. → Correct (specifies the bus departure time)

8. Who made the cake for the party?
(A) Just a cup of apple juice. → Incorrect (unrelated to cake maker)
(B) I already ate. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) The baker on Second Street. → Correct (identifies who made the cake)

9. Why are you taking French classes?
(A) Do you have a reservation? → Incorrect (unrelated to French classes)
(B) Because I'm transferring to the Paris office. → Correct (explains the reason for taking classes)
(C) Two days a week. → Incorrect (refers to frequency, not reason)

10. What material is this shirt made of?
(A) It's a light cotton fabric. → Correct (specifies the shirt’s material)
(B) No, I don't need any more supplies. → Incorrect (unrelated to material)
(C) In small, medium, and large sizes. → Incorrect (refers to sizes, not material)

11. How much will the jazz concert cost?
(A) Leaving from platform six. → Incorrect (unrelated to cost)
(B) The ticket's 50 dollars. → Correct (specifies the concert cost)
(C) A seat on the aisle, please. → Incorrect (refers to seating, not cost)

12. Where's the robotics conference going to be held?
(A) I'll print your first chapter. → Incorrect (unrelated to conference location)
(B) At the end of June. → Incorrect (refers to time, not location)
(C) It's in Boston. → Correct (specifies the conference location)

13. Would you like me to turn on the air conditioner?
(A) I bought shampoo and conditioner. → Incorrect (misinterprets 'conditioner' and is irrelevant)
(B) He did an excellent job! → Incorrect (unrelated to air conditioner)
(C) No—let's open the windows. → Correct (responds to the request)

14. When do you need a copy of the contract?
(A) As soon as possible. → Correct (specifies the timing for the contract copy)
(B) A savings account at the bank. → Incorrect (unrelated to the contract)
(C) Sure—here's my contact information. → Incorrect (irrelevant to timing)

15. I definitely think we should reschedule the picnic.
(A) Is it supposed to rain? → Correct (seeks a reason for rescheduling)
(B) A company celebration. → Incorrect (describes the event, not rescheduling)
(C) Some salad with a light dressing. → Incorrect (unrelated to rescheduling)

16. How often is this filing cabinet organized?
(A) About once every quarter. → Correct (specifies the organization frequency)
(B) Yes, this is the right size. → Incorrect (unrelated to frequency)
(C) A fifteen-minute meeting. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

17. Is Ms. Lee planning to run for mayor in the election?
(A) I go there often, actually. → Incorrect (unrelated to election plans)
(B) An electronic reading device. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) Yes, she made the official announcement. → Correct (confirms Ms. Lee’s plans)

18. Are you looking for a one-bedroom or a two-bedroom apartment?
(A) No, I've had enough coffee today. → Incorrect (unrelated to apartment choice)
(B) A two-bedroom apartment with a balcony. → Correct (specifies the apartment preference)
(C) At the home-improvement store. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

19. You should include an image on each page of the book.
(A) The bookstore is closed. → Incorrect (unrelated to the suggestion)
(B) Yes, that's a good idea. → Correct (agrees with the suggestion)
(C) A job as a graphic designer. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

20. How do I make changes to this section of the Web site?
(A) Only five more times. → Incorrect (unrelated to website changes)
(B) Let me show you. → Correct (offers assistance with the process)
(C) Can I preorder my meal? → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

21. Will you be working a half day or a full day?
(A) My project deadline is tomorrow. → Correct (this answer)
(B) Here's an empty glass. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) About 73 euros. → Incorrect (refers to cost, not hours)

22. There's an opening in my department for an accountant.
(A) I have some experience with that. → Correct (shows interest in the position)
(B) They agreed to participate. → Incorrect (unrelated to the opening)
(C) No, the store is closed. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

23. Isn't the shuttle between terminals fully automated?
(A) The windows in this room don't open. → Incorrect (unrelated to shuttle automation)
(B) No, just a one-way ticket please. → Incorrect (refers to tickets, not automation)
(C) I've actually never been to that airport. → Correct (this answer)

24. What's the product code for that item?
(A) I saw the advertisement on television. → Incorrect (unrelated to product code)
(B) Batteries are included in the box. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) All the information is on the invoice. → Correct (directs to where the code can be found)

25. Why don't we rent a bigger booth at this year's conference?
(A) The conference call went really well. → Incorrect (unrelated to booth size)
(B) Our budget is very tight. → Correct (explains why a bigger booth may not be feasible)
(C) I think the vent on the dryer is clogged. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

26. Carmen's computer needs to be repaired, doesn't it?
(A) She bought a new one. → Correct (implies repair is unnecessary due to replacement)
(B) I'll bring a pair of gloves on the hike. → Incorrect (unrelated to the computer)
(C) A degree in computer science. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

27. Who are the candidates for new branch manager?
(A) Yes, I do like my new office. → Incorrect (unrelated to candidates)
(B) No, I'm not available at that time. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) We're still accepting applications. → Correct (addresses the candidate selection process)

28. Did the focus group like the advertisement we designed?
(A) Some well-known magazines. → Incorrect (unrelated to focus group feedback)
(B) We'll need to make some changes. → Correct (implies the group’s feedback was not fully positive)
(C) Turn left at the stop sign. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

29. Please let me know when you arrive in Osaka.
(A) The clients are great to work with. → Incorrect (unrelated to arrival notification)
(B) How many did you buy? → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) I always carry my smartphone with me. → Correct (this answer)

30. Where exactly is the employee cafeteria located?
(A) There's a new research report available. → Incorrect (unrelated to cafeteria location)
(B) I'm headed over to lunch now. → Correct (this answer)
(C) Here's your ID badge. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

31. You're meeting with the clients on Thursday, aren't you?
(A) Our software is updated every Wednesday. → Incorrect (unrelated to the meeting)
(B) It's an all-vegetarian menu, without any meat. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) That contract is already signed. → Correct (this answer)
